previously ''Coca-Cola'' worker<ref>{{cite news|title=Hunt for Hayat: Where is she?|url=http://www.news.com.au/world/breaking-news/charlie-hebdo-paris-hayat-boumeddiene-on-the-run-after-hostage-siege-and-shootings-in-kosher-grocery-store/story-e6frfkui-1227180329412|publisher=News.com.au|date=10 January 2015}}</ref> | known_for ={{plainlist | *[[Hypercacher Kosher Supermarket siege]] *[[January 2015 Île-de-France attacks|Montrouge shooting]] *[[January 2015 Île-de-France attacks#Fontenay-aux-Roses and Montrouge shootings|Fontenay-aux-Roses shooting]] }} | religion = Islam | criminal_charge = [[Robbery]], [[drug trafficking]], assisting plot to break out Islamist terrorist from prison (December 2013) | conviction_status = Convicted; Released early, in March 2014 | spouse = [[Hayat Boumeddiene]] | allegiance = [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]] | motive = | capture_status = Killed | partners = [[Charlie Hebdo shooting|Saïd and Chérif Kouachi]] | date = 8–9 January 2015 | locations = *[[Porte de Vincennes]] *[[Montrouge]] *[[Fontenay-aux-Roses]] | targets = *Patrons of kosher supermarket *Police officer *Jogger | fatalities = 5 | injuries = 11 | weapons = * [[Škorpion vz. 61]] [[submachine gun]] * [[vz. 58]] [[assault rifle]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/france/11352978/Charlie-Hebdo-attack-French-police-investigate-whether-there-was-a-fourth-Paris-gunman.html|title=Charlie Hebdo attack: French police investigate whether there was a fourth Paris gunman|author=David Chazan|date=17 January 2015|work=The Telegraph}}</ref> * Two [[TT pistol|Tokarev pistol]]s<ref name="ABC News">{{cite web|title=Charlie Hebdo shooting: Amedy Coulibaly linked to attack on jogger after magazine massacre|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2015-01-12/french-attacker-amedy-coulibaly-linked-to-shooting/6011510|date=11 January 2015|work=[[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News]]|accessdate=13 January 2015}}</ref> | conviction_penalty = Five years in prison }}
'''Amedy Coulibaly''' ({{IPA-fr|amɛdi kulibali}}; 27 February 1982 – 9 January 2015) was a [[Malians in France|Malian-French]] man who was the prime suspect in the [[January 2015 Île-de-France attacks|Montrouge shooting]], in which [[Municipal Police (France)|municipal police]] officer Clarissa Jean-Philippe was shot and killed, and was the hostage-taker and gunman in the [[Hypercacher Kosher Supermarket siege]], in which he killed four hostages before being killed by police.
He was a close friend of [[Charlie Hebdo shooting#Ch.C3.A9rif and Sa.C3.AFd Kouachi|Saïd and Chérif Kouachi]], the gunmen in the [[Charlie Hebdo shooting|''Charlie Hebdo'' shooting]], to which Coulibaly's shootings were connected. He said he synchronized his attacks with the Kouachi brothers.<ref name="davidgauthier-villarsinparis,asafitchindubaiandrajaabdulrahiminbeirut1">{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/video-appears-to-show-paris-kosher-grocery-attack-suspect-coulibaly-swearing-allegiance-to-islamic-state-1420977506|title=Islamic State Releases Video Calling Grocery Store Gunman Its ‘Soldier’|author=David Gauthier-Villars in Paris, Asa Fitch in Dubai and Raja Abdulrahim in Beirut|date=12 January 2015|work=The Wall Street Journal}}</ref><ref name="lemonde.fr">[http://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2015/01/09/fusillade-de-montrouge-suspect-identifie-deux-nouvelles-interpellations_4552503_3224.html Le suspect de Montrouge, Amedy Coulibaly, était bien le tireur de Vincennes], ''Le Monde'' (in French)</ref> Coulibaly had pledged allegiance to the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]].<ref name="janeonyanga-omara,usatoday">{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2015/01/11/video-gunman-islamic-state/21589723/|title=Video shows Paris gunman pledging allegiance to Islamic State|author=Jane Onyanga-Omara|date=11 January 2015|work=USA Today}}</ref>
His wife, [[Hayat Boumeddiene]], is currently being sought by French police as a suspected accomplice of Coulibaly, alleged to have helped him commit his attacks. She arrived in Turkey five days before the attacks.<ref name="theguardian.com">{{cite web|title=Islamic State magazine interviews Hayat Boumeddiene|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/feb/12/islamic-state-magazine-interviews-hayat-boumeddiene|website=Guardian.com|accessdate=15 November 2015}}</ref> She has been described by newspapers as "France's most wanted woman". She was last tracked on 10 January 2015 to the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]]-controlled border town of [[Tell Abyad]] in Syria.
==Early life== [[File:GrandeBornePlaineCentrale.jpg|thumb|left|260px| Coulibaly grew up on [[La Grande Borne]] housing estate.]] Coulibaly was born in [[Juvisy-sur-Orge]], a suburb south-east of Paris, into a [[Mali]]an Muslim immigrant family.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leparisien.fr/faits-divers/attentats-la-mere-et-les-soeurs-de-coulibaly-condamnent-ces-actes-odieux-11-01-2015-4435963.php|title=Attentats: la mère et les soeurs de Coulibaly "condamnent ces actes odieux"|work=Le Parisien|date=11 January 2015|accessdate=13 January 2015|language=French}}</ref><ref name="cnn.com">{{cite web|url=http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/1501/17/cnr.07.html|title=Europe on Alert for Terror Attacks|work=CNN}}</ref> He was the only boy, with nine sisters. He grew up on a housing estate, [[La Grande Borne]], in [[Grigny, Essonne|Grigny]], south of Paris.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/jan/12/-sp-charlie-hebdo-attackers-kids-france-radicalised-paris "Charlie Hebdo attackers: born, raised and radicalised in Paris"], ''The Guardian'', 12 January 2015</ref>
Starting at the age of 17, he was convicted five times for armed robbery and at least once for drug trafficking.<ref name="cnn.com"/><ref name="stacymeichtry,noémiebisserbeandbenoîtfaucon">{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/paris-attackers-path-to-terror-1421204761|title=Paris Attacker Amedy Coulibaly’s Path to Terror|author=Stacy Meichtry, Noémie Bisserbe and Benoît Faucon|date=14 January 2015|work=The Wall Street Journal}}</ref> A report by a psychiatric expert prepared for a Parisian court found Coulibaly had an "immature and [[psychopathic]] personality" and "poor powers of introspection".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/01/09/amedy-coulibaly-paris-kosher-market_n_6444418.html|title=Amedy Coulibaly, Paris Kosher Market Terrorist, Had History Of Ties To Violence|date=9 January 2015|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref>
==Activities prior to 2015 shootings== In 2004, Coulibaly was sentenced to six years in [[Fleury-Mérogis Prison]] for armed bank robbery.<ref name="stacymeichtry,noémiebisserbeandbenoîtfaucon"/> There, he met [[Chérif Kouachi]]. He is believed to have [[Islamist radicalization in European prisons|converted to radical Islam in prison]] at the same time as Chérif.<ref name="nydailynews.com">{{cite web|work=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]|location=New York|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/crime/terrorist-amedy-coulibaly-met-french-prez-nicolas-sarkozy-article-1.2072074|title=Terrorist Amedy Coulibaly met former French President Nicolas Sarkozy in 2009, years before Paris murder spree|date=9 January 2015|accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> In prison he also met al-Qaeda recruiter Djamel Beghal, who was in "isolation" in the cell above him but whom he was nevertheless able to communicate with.<ref name="mtv.com.lb">{{cite web|url=https://mtv.com.lb/en/News/439798|title=MTV Lebanon – The making of a French jihadi|work=mtv.com.lb}}</ref> He later said that his discovery of Islam in prison changed him.<ref>{{cite news|last1=NOEMIE BISSERBE|title=European Prisons Fueling Spread of Islamic Radicalism|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/european-prisons-fueling-spread-of-islamic-radicalism-1470001491|accessdate=1 August 2016|work=The Wall Street Journal|date=31 July 2016|quote='Prison changed me,' Coulibaly would later tell French journalist Warda Mohamed after his release in 2008. Ms. Mohamed, a French journalist who interviewed Coulibaly as part of a documentary on prison life, said she didn't publish the comments at the time. 'I learnt about Islam in prison. Before that I wasn’t interested, now I pray,' Coulibaly told Ms. Mohamed, she said.}}</ref>
After release from prison he married Hayat Boumeddiene on 5 July 2009 in an [[Islamic marital practices|Islamic religious ceremony]].<ref name="stacymeichtry,noémiebisserbeandbenoîtfaucon"/><ref name="parfrançoislabrouillèreetaurélieraya">{{cite web|url=http://www.parismatch.com/Actu/Societe/Hayat-Boumeddiene-et-Amedy-Coulibaly-Le-destin-monstrueux-d-un-couple-ordinaire-700346|title=Hayat Boumeddiene et Amedy Coulibaly – Le destin monstrueux d’un couple ordinaire|author=François Labrouillère et Aurélie Raya|date=30 January 2015|work=Paris Match|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20150112-manhunt-female-accomplice-french-attacks/|title=France – Manhunt on for female accomplice in French attacks|work=France 24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=From bikini babe to burka-clad jihadi fighter with a crossbow: 'Wife' of Kosher supermarket killer becomes France's most wanted woman after going on the run|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2903601/Wife-Kosher-supermarket-killer-armed-dangerous-run-police-warn.html|date=9 January 2015|work=[[Daily Mail]]|accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> Boumeddiene's father stood in for her at the marriage service.<ref name="stacymeichtry,noémiebisserbeandbenoîtfaucon"/> On 15 July 2009, while involved in an effort promoting youth employment, Coulibaly, along with about 500 others, met with then-President [[Nicolas Sarkozy]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://time.com/3661840/amedy-coulibaly-nicolas-sarkozy/|title=Paris Attacker Met French President in 2009|date=9 January 2015|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref>
A source stated that Coulibaly "was friends of both of" the Kouachi brothers, and he had first met Cherif in prison.<ref name="dpa-international.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.dpa-international.com/news/international/updateprofilethe-kouachi-brothers-and-amedy-coulibaly-comrades-in-terrorism-a-43827912.html|title=The Kouachi brothers and Amedy Coulibaly: comrades in terrorism|publisher=dpa-international.com|date=9 January 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150110022859/http://www.dpa-international.com/news/international/updateprofilethe-kouachi-brothers-and-amedy-coulibaly-comrades-in-terrorism-a-43827912.html|archivedate=10 January 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="cbc.ca">[http://www.cbc.ca/m/news/world/charlie-hebdo-attack-hayat-boumeddiene-may-be-in-syria-1.2896462 "Charlie Hebdo attack: Hayat Boumeddiene may be in Syria; Common law wife of supermarket attacker is believed have passed through Turkey on Jan. 2"], CBC News</ref> Coulibaly and the Kouachi brothers were known members of the {{Interlanguage link multi|Buttes-Chaumont network|fr|3=Filière des Buttes-Chaumont|lt="Buttes-Chaumont network"}}. The name comes from the nearby [[Parc des Buttes Chaumont]], where they often met and performed military-style training exercises with other French-Algerian extremists.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/suspect-in-paris-attack-had-long-term-obsession-carrying-out-terror-attack/2015/01/08/b36f6c90-974e-11e4-aabd-d0b93ff613d5_story.html|title=Suspect in Paris attack had ‘long-term obsession’ carrying out terror attack|work=The Washington Post}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/france/11334249/Charlie-Hebdo-attack-the-Kouachi-brothers-and-the-network-of-French-Islamists-with-links-to-Islamic-State.html|title=Charlie Hebdo attack: the Kouachi brothers and the network of French Islamists with links to Islamic State|date=8 January 2015|work=The Telegraph}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/news/butte-chaumont-network-paris-attacks-who-did-he|title='Buttes Chaumont' network behind Paris attacks|publisher=Channel 4|date=9 January 2015}}</ref> Coulibaly is believed to have been radicalised by an Islamic preacher in Paris, and had expressed a desire to fight in either Iraq or Syria.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/551058/Paris-police-officer-shot-dead-named-Clarissa-Jean-Philippe|title=Shooting of Paris police officer LINKED to Charlie Hebdo massacre|work=Daily Express|date=9 January 2015}}</ref>
Ten months after his meeting with Sarkozy, in May 2010 police arrested him and searched his apartment. They found ammunition, a crossbow, and letters seeking false official documents.<ref name="stacymeichtry,noémiebisserbeandbenoîtfaucon"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/national/hunt-for-terrorists-wife-as-more-attacks-feared/ar-AA7Zdkj|title=Hunt For Terrorist's Wife As More Attacks Feared|work=MSN}}</ref> Coulibaly maintained that he was planning to sell the ammunition on the street.<ref name="nydailynews.com"/> In December 2013 he was sentenced to five years in prison for supplying ammunition for a plot to break out from prison radical French-Algerian Islamist Smain Ait Ali Belkacem (who had planned the [[1995 Paris Métro and RER bombings]]),<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/hayat-boumeddiene-interviewed-by-police-in-2010-2015-1|title=Hayat Boumeddiene Interviewed By Police In 2010 |date=12 January 2015|work=Business Insider}}</ref><ref name="tabletmag.com">{{cite web|url=http://tabletmag.com/scroll/188518/kosher-supermarket-gunman-caught-on-tape-casing-jewish-school-in-august|title=Paris Kosher Supermarket Gunman Amedy Coulibaly Caught on Tape Casing Jewish School in August|work=Tablet Magazine}}</ref><ref name=video>Rukmini Callimachi and Andrew Higginjan (11 January 2015). [https://www.nytimes.com/2015/01/12/world/europe/amedy-coulibaly-video-islamic-state.html?_r=0 "Video Shows a Paris Gunman Declaring His Loyalty to the Islamic State"], ''The New York Times''</ref> a plot in which the Kouachi brothers were also involved.<ref name="cbc.ca"/> However, Coulibaly was released early from [[Villepinte, Seine-Saint-Denis|Villepinte]] prison outside Paris, in March 2014.<ref name="noémiebisserbe,benoîtfauconandstacymeichtry">{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/underground-terror-network-said-to-benefit-would-be-jihadists-in-europe-1422577767|title=Underground Terror Network Said to Benefit Would-Be Jihadists in Europe|author=Noémie Bisserbe, Benoît Faucon And Stacy Meichtry|date=30 January 2015|work=The Wall Street Journal}}</ref><ref name="International Business Times">{{cite web|title=Who Is Amedy Coulibaly? Paris Kosher Deli Gunman Once Worked For Coca-Cola, Was Close With Kouachi Brothers|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/who-amedy-coulibaly-paris-kosher-deli-gunman-once-worked-coca-cola-was-close-kouachi-1779242|date=9 January 2015|work=[[International Business Times]]|accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref><ref name = "NYT backgrounder">{{Cite news | last1 = Callimachi | first1 = Rukmini | last2 = Yardley | first2 = Jim | date = 17 January 2015 | title = Chérif and Saïd Kouachi's Path to Paris Attack at Charlie Hebdo | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2015/01/18/world/europe/paris-terrorism-brothers-said-cherif-kouachi-charlie-hebdo.html | work = New York Times | accessdate = 20 January 2015 }}</ref> He was required to wear an [[electronic bracelet]] until May 2014.<ref name="tabletmag.com"/>
In August 2014, Coulibaly and his wife approached a [[Jewish school]], and inquired if there were Jews inside.<ref name="tabletmag.com"/> The security guard asked them to leave.<ref name="tabletmag.com"/>
A week before the attacks, on 4 January 2015 Coulibaly rented a house in [[Gentilly, Val-de-Marne]], in the southern Paris suburbs. There, after the attacks, police discovered automatic weapons, a grenade launcher, smoke grenades and bombs, handguns, industrial explosives, and flags of the Islamic State.<ref name=video/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-30832444|title=Paris attacks: Investigators turn up new leads|work=BBC News}}</ref><ref>[http://www.kptv.com/story/27852855/paris-gunmans-safe-house-could-hold-clues-to-4th-attacker "Paris gunman's safe house could hold clues to 4th-attacker"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150120134326/http://www.kptv.com/story/27852855/paris-gunmans-safe-house-could-hold-clues-to-4th-attacker |date=20 January 2015 }}, Fox 12 Oregon</ref>
He had pledged allegiance to [[Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi]] and the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]], as he put it, "as soon as the caliphate was declared," which was in the summer of 2014.<ref name=video/> He stated this, and described how he and the Kouachi brothers had synchronized their attacks and were "a team, in league together," in a video posted on Twitter days after he and the brothers were killed.<ref name="davidgauthier-villarsinparis,asafitchindubaiandrajaabdulrahiminbeirut1"/><ref name="janeonyanga-omara,usatoday"/><ref name=video/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/01/20/paris-attack-suspects_n_6511996.html|title=4 Men In Paris Court Are 1st To Face Terror Attacks Charges|work=The Huffington Post}}</ref><ref name="independent.co.uk">{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/ahmed-coulibaly-isis-video-footage-shows-paris-supermarket-gunman-pledging-allegiance-to-islamic-state-9970600.html|title=Amedy Coulibaly Isis video: Footage shows Paris supermarket gunman pledging allegiance to 'Islamic State'|work=The Independent}}</ref><ref name="independent.co.uk"/><ref name="telegraph.co.uk1">{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/france/11338159/Paris-attacks-video-emerges-of-Amedy-Coulibaly-pledging-allegiance-to-Isil.html|title=Jihadi video of Amedy Coulibaly emerges from beyond the grave; Amedy Coulibaly, the gunman who killed four people in a Jewish grocery, says he helped to fund the Kouachi brothers' attack on the satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo |date=11 January 2015|work=The Telegraph}}</ref> Text in the video states that Coulibaly had killed a policewoman and "five Jews."<ref name="telegraph.co.uk1"/> The video captions him with the names "Amedy Coulibaly" and "Abou Bassir Abdallah al-Ifriqi".<ref name="davidgauthier-villarsinparis,asafitchindubaiandrajaabdulrahiminbeirut1"/> As the video includes news reports of his attack on the kosher supermarket, it was edited by someone after he was killed.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/jan/11/paris-supermarket-attacker-islamic-state-video-isis-amedy-coulibaly|title=Paris supermarket attacker claims allegiance to Islamic State in video|author=Shiv Malik|work=The Guardian}}</ref>
==Shootings on 7–9 January 2015== {{See also|Hypercacher Kosher Supermarket siege|January 2015 Île-de-France attacks#Fontenay-aux-Roses and Montrouge shootings}} Coulibaly is said to be responsible for three shootings, and he said he synchronized his attacks with the Kouachi brothers.<ref name="davidgauthier-villarsinparis,asafitchindubaiandrajaabdulrahiminbeirut1"/> In the shootings, five people were killed and eleven others were wounded.
The first shooting was of a jogger who was wounded on the evening of 7 January in [[Fontenay-aux-Roses]]. Shell casings found at the scene were later linked to the weapon carried by Coulibaly in his kosher supermarket attack.<ref name="davidgauthier-villarsinparis,asafitchindubaiandrajaabdulrahiminbeirut1"/>
The second shooting occurred in [[Montrouge]] on 8 January. Clarissa Jean-Philippe, an unarmed French policewoman, was killed, and a street sweeper was critically injured. DNA found at the scene was a match to Coulibaly.<ref name="coloradonewsday.com"/><ref name="davidgauthier-villarsinparis,asafitchindubaiandrajaabdulrahiminbeirut1"/><ref name="diondassanayake">{{cite web|url=http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/551314/Jewish-supermarket-siege-Paris-hero-hostage-tried-to-shot-Amedy-Coulibaly|title=Jewish supermarket siege: Heroic hostage executed after trying to turn weapon on gunman |author=Dion Dassanayake|work=Daily Express}}</ref>
The third shooting took place at [[Porte de Vincennes]], east Paris, on 9 January. Coulibaly killed four more people, all Jewish patrons at a Jewish [[Hypercacher]] supermarket at Porte de Vincennes, at the outset of an hours-long siege in which he demanded that the Kouachi brothers be freed.<ref name="ABC News"/><ref name="lemonde.fr"/><ref name="independent.co.uk"/><ref name="foxnews.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2015/01/11/french-authorities-hunt-most-wanted-woman-in-france-fears-new-terror-attack/|title=France's most wanted woman may have traveled to Syria, reports say|work=Fox News}}</ref><ref name="BBClive">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/live/world-europe-30722098|title=Charlie Hebdo attack: Manhunt – live reporting|publisher=BBC News|date=9 January 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/world/1.636178|title=Paris shooting updates / Charlie Hebdo attackers take hostage after car chase|date=9 January 2015|work=Haaretz}}</ref><ref>[http://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2015/01/11/ce-que-l-on-sait-de-l-agression-d-un-joggeur-a-fontenay-aux-roses_4553732_3224.html Ce que l'on sait de l'agression d'un joggeur à Fontenay-aux-Roses] – ''Le Monde'' – Emeline Cazi – 11 January 2014 (in French)</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/jan/11/paris-gunman-amedy-coulibaly-allegiance-isis|title=Paris gunman Amedy Coulibaly declared allegiance to Isis|date=11 January 2015|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=13 January 2015}}</ref> At the outset of that attack, he introduced himself to his hostages, saying: "I am Amedy Coulibaly, Malian and Muslim. I belong to the Islamic State."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/france/11338026/Amid-the-terror-a-hero-who-lost-his-life-by-fighting-back.html|title=Amid the terror, a hero who lost his life by fighting back|date=10 January 2015|work=The Telegraph}}</ref> French commandos stormed the store, and killed Coulibaly.<ref name="diondassanayake"/> He left in his car maps indicating the locations of Jewish schools in Paris.<ref>[https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/paris-terror-attack-jewish-schools-4961800]</ref> * A [[Nagant M1895]] revolver was also found in the possession of Coulibaly.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nrc.nl/nieuws/2017/01/13/hoe-een-antieke-revolver-in-handen-kwam-van-criminelen-en-terroristen-6194644-a1541273|title=Hoe een antieke revolver in handen kwam van criminelen en terroristen|newspaper=nrc.nl|access-date=2017-01-15}}</ref>
==Aftermath== After [[Mali]] refused to accept Coulibaly's body for burial, he was buried in an unmarked grave in the Muslim section of a cemetery in [[Thiais]].<ref name="coloradonewsday.com"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2015/01/23/terrorist-buried-near-paris-after-mali-rejects-corpse/|title=Terrorist buried near Paris after Mali rejects corpse|work=New York Post}}</ref>
His wife, [[Hayat Boumeddiene]], is currently being sought by French police as a suspected accomplice of Coulibaly, alleged to have helped him commit his attacks. She arrived in Turkey five days before the attacks.<ref name="theguardian.com"/> She has been described by newspapers as "France's most wanted woman". She was last tracked on 10 January 2015 to the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]]-controlled border town of [[Tell Abyad]] in Syria.

<!-- Deleted image removed: [[File:Iraqi Interview Of American POWs.jpg|frame|right|{{Deletable image-caption|1=Friday, 28 March 2008|date=May 2012}}|{{FFDC|1=Image:Iraqi Interview Of American POWs.jpg|log=2008 March 21|date=May 2012}}]] --> The [[2003 invasion of Iraq]], which lasted from March 20 – May 1, 2003, resulted in a small number of American and [[Multinational force in Iraq|Coalition]] [[prisoner of war|POWs]].
==507th's wrong turn== A majority of the prisoners of war were captured from the ambush of the [[507th Maintenance Company]]. Separated from a larger convoy, they were ambushed in the Iraqi-held town of [[Nasiriyah]] on March 23, 2003. Out of thirty-three soldiers, eleven were killed and seven captured in the fire fight. Several weapons jammed in the firefight.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2003/07/10/world/after-the-war-inquiry-report-says-errors-and-fatigue-led-to-ambush-of-convoy.html|title=AFTER THE WAR: INQUIRY; Report Says Errors and Fatigue Led to Ambush of Convoy|last=Schmitt|first=Eric|date=7/10/2003|work=New York Times|access-date=11/3/2018}}</ref> The following soldiers were captured by Iraqi forces:
{|class="wikitable sortable nowraplinks" |- ! Name !! Rank !! Age when Captured !! Hometown !! Notes |- |Edgar Hernandez||Specialist||21||[[Mission, Texas]]||Shot once in the bicep of his right arm. |- |Joseph Hudson||Specialist||23||[[Alamogordo, New Mexico]]||Shot three times, twice in the ribs and once in the upper left buttocks. |- |[[Shoshana Johnson]]||Specialist||30||[[El Paso, Texas]]||A naturalized American from [[Panama]], she was shot with a single bullet that sliced through both ankles. She was the first black woman ever taken prisoner in American military history. |- |[[Jessica Lynch]]||Private First Class||19||[[Palestine, Wirt County, West Virginia|Palestine, West Virginia]]||She suffered a head laceration, an injury to her spine, and fractures to her right arm, both legs, and her right foot and ankle. She was knocked unconscious after her [[Humvee]] crashed. |- |[[Patrick Miller (soldier)|Patrick Miller]]||Private First Class||23||[[Wichita, Kansas]]||Awarded the Silver Star, Purple Heart, and Prisoner of War Medal. |- |James Riley||Sergeant||31||[[Pennsauken, New Jersey]]||As the senior soldier present, it was he who ordered the surrender. |}
==Capture== When they surrendered, they feared the worst. Miller held out little hope for mercy. "I thought they were going to kill me," he said. "That was the first thing I asked when they captured me: 'Are you going to kill me?' They said no. . . . I still didn't believe them."<ref name="CNN">{{cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2003/WORLD/meast/04/14/sprj.irq.pows/index.html|title=Former POW: 'We were like Custer'|accessdate=2006-12-18 |publisher=CNN|date=April 14, 2003}}</ref>
==Iraqi TV Interview== Soon after their capture, Jessica Lynch was taken to an Iraqi hospital due to her serious injuries. The other five POWs did not know about Lynch surviving until after they were released. After their capture, the five remaining members of the ambushed 507th would become famous as bloody and beaten. They were then interviewed by Iraq TV, and the footage was shown worldwide by [[Al Jazeera]]. In the interview, [[Patrick Miller (soldier)|Private First Class Patrick Miller]] was asked why he came to Iraq; his reply was "I come to fix broke stuff." Asked if he came to shoot Iraqis, he answered, "No, I come to shoot only if I am shot at. They don't bother me, I don't bother them." <ref name="Interview">{{cite news |url=https://www.usatoday.com/news/world/iraq/2003-03-23-pows-iraq-usat_x.htm|title=Iraq puts captive troops on TV|accessdate=2006-12-18 |agency=Associated Press|date=March 24, 2003|work=USA Today}}</ref>
==Two More Makes Eight== On March 24, they were joined by Chief Warrant Officers David Williams, 31, and [[Ron Young (US Army officer)|Ronald Young Jr.]], 26, whose Apache chopper, from the 1-227 Helicopter Attack Battalion, had been shot down in central Iraq during the [[2003 attack on Karbala|attack on Karbala.]]
==Relocation== The prisoners were taken to [[Baghdad]], where they were isolated in separate cells of a drab [[prison]] with concrete walls and a tin roof. As American troops got closer, the soldiers were shuffled from building to building. The Iraqi captors worked feverishly to stay one step ahead of the advancing units.
==Rescue== As it became clear that the war was over for the Iraqis, some of their captors approached a Marine unit from the [[3rd Light Armored Reconnaissance Battalion|3rd Light Armored Reconnaissance Battalion, Delta Co., 3rd Platoon]] which was a part of [[Task Force Tripoli]] that had been pushing up toward [[Tikrit]], [[Saddam Hussein]]'s hometown. A Marine battalion was sent to check on the intelligence and found the seven POWs with a confused Iraqi guard unit, whose officers had fled.
On April 13, 2003, 21 days after the 507th members were captured, the 3rd Light Armored Recon Marines burst in on the Iraqi guards who gave up without a fight. Ordering everyone on the floor, a Marine gave an order to "stand up if you're American!" Given dirty prison clothes and fed little food, the prisoners lost a lot of weight and with their garb, and beards they looked like Iraqis. "At first," [[Shoshana Johnson|Spc. Shoshana Johnson]] remembers that, "they didn't realize I was American. They said, 'Get down, get down,' and one of them said, 'No, she's American.' "<ref name="SF">{{cite news |url=http://sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2003/04/14/MN252903.DTL|title=Freedom for 7 American POWs|accessdate=2006-12-18 |last=Peter Baker, Washington Post|date= April 14, 2003|work=The San Francisco Chronicle}}</ref>
Within hours, the seven were on their way to Kuwait International Airport inside a Marine Corps KC-130 transport plane, the first stop before the United States. Amid sobs, cheers and laughter, they told their stories to two reporters accompanying them on the flight. "I broke down. I was like, 'Oh my God, I'm home,'" Johnson said.<ref name="CNN"/>
==War crimes== During the [[2003 invasion of Iraq]], Iraqi [[Saddam Fedayeen]] irregular forces were involved in executing several Coalition prisoners of war.
Sergeant [[Donald Walters]] was initially reported to have been killed in the March 23 ambush of the [[507th Maintenance Company]]. However, witnesses later reported that they had seen Walters being guarded by several Fedayeen in front of a building. Forensics work later found Walters' blood in front of the building and blood spatter suggesting he died from two gunshot wounds to the back at close range. This led the Army to conclude that Walters had been executed after being captured.<ref>[http://www.cnn.com/2004/US/05/27/iraq.pow/index.html Status changed for soldier killed in Iraq: Investigation shows POW was murdered - CNN]</ref>
[[Jessica Lynch]] was reportedly raped and sodomized by Iraqi forces, based on scars, though she has no recollection of it happening.<ref>https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/nov/07/usa.iraq</ref>
Also on March 23, a British Army engineering unit made a wrong turn near the town of [[Az Zubayr]], which was still held by Iraqi forces. The unit was ambushed and Sapper Luke Allsopp and Staff Sergeant Simon Cullingworth became separated from the rest. Both were captured and executed by Iraqi forces. In 2006, a video of Allsopp lying on the ground surrounded by Iraqi irregular forces was discovered.<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/1530205/Soldier-killed-in-convoy-ambush-'was-alive-for-four-hours-surrounded-by-mob'.html Soldier killed in convoy ambush 'was alive for four hours surrounded by mob' - The Telegraph]</ref>
Marine Sergeant Fernando Padilla-Ramirez was reported missing from his supply unit after an ambush north of [[Nasiriyah]] on March 28. His body was later dragged through the streets of [[Ash Shatrah]] and hung in the town square. His body was later taken down and buried by sympathetic locals. His body was discovered by American forces on April 10.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.azcentral.com/specials/special45/articles/profiles-part1.html |title=Invasion: Into the breach |publisher=Azcentral.com |date=2006-08-04 |accessdate=2013-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.defenselink.mil/Releases/Release.aspx?ReleaseID%3D3750 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2008-09-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080910142414/http://www.defenselink.mil/Releases/Release.aspx?ReleaseID=3750 |archivedate=2008-09-10 |df= }}</ref><ref>Wright 2004, p. 228</ref>
In addition, the showing of captured soldiers on television, as was done with some of the captured soldiers of the [[507th Maintenance Company]], was a violation of the [[Geneva Conventions]].
==See also== * <!--U.S. Army SSG--> [[Ahmed Kousay Altaie]] - A U.S. Army soldier who was captured by Iraqi insurgents and executed * <!--U.S. Marine CPL--> [[Wassef Ali Hassoun]] - A U.S. Marine who claimed to be captured by Iraqi insurgents; later discovered to be a hoax * [[2004 Iraq KBR convoy ambush]] - Capture and execution of Keith Matthew Maupin, a U.S. Army soldier * [[June 2006 abduction of U.S. soldiers in Iraq]] - Capture and execution of Kristian Menchaca and Thomas L. Tucker, two U.S. Army soldiers * [[Karbala provincial headquarters raid]] - Capture and execution of Brian Freeman, Jacob Fritz, Jonathan Chism and Shawn Falter, four U.S. Army soldiers * [[May 2007 abduction of U.S. soldiers in Iraq]] - Capture and execution of Alex Ramon Jimenez, Joseph John Anzack and Byron Wayne Fouty, three U.S. Army soldiers
==References== {{Reflist}}
==Further reading== * Wright, Evan (2004), ''Generation Kill'', Berkley Publishing Group {{ISBN|0-399-15193-1}} * Lowry, Richard S. (2006), ''Marines in the Garden of Eden'', Berkley Publishing Group {{ISBN|0-425-21529-6}}

{{Plainlist| * Michelle Knight * Amanda Berry * Georgina "Gina" DeJesus }} | perp = {{Plainlist| * Ariel Castro }} }} The '''Ariel Castro kidnappings''' took place between 2002 and 2004 when three young women — Michelle Knight, Amanda Berry, and Georgina "Gina" DeJesus — were kidnapped by Ariel Castro and held captive in his home in the [[Tremont, Cleveland|Tremont]] neighborhood of [[Cleveland]], in the [[U.S. state]] of [[Ohio]]. They were subsequently imprisoned until May 6, 2013, when Berry escaped with her six-year-old daughter and contacted the police.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/frantic-911-call-leads-3-missing-women-ohio |title=Police Facing Questions in 3 Women's Ohio Rescue |last1=Sheeran |first1=Thomas |last2=Coyne |first2=John |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-22430145 |title=Three US women missing for years rescued in Ohio |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=BBC |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512163039/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-22430145 |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=cnn050713>{{cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/06/us/ohio-missing-women-found/ |title=911 call – 'I've been kidnapped!' – cops find three women missing for year |last1=Almasy |first1=Steve |last2=Smith |first2=Matt |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6ZebQK?url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/06/us/ohio-missing-women-found/ |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news | last = Sherwell | first = Philip | date = May 7, 2013 | title = Ohio abductions: friendship between Ariel Castro's daughter and Gina DeJesus | newspaper = [[The Daily Telegraph]] | publisher = [[Telegraph Media Group]] | publication-place = London, England | url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10042659/Ohio-abductions-friendship-between-Ariel-Castros-daughter-and-Gina-DeJesus.html | accessdate = May 16, 2013 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130508025936/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10042659/Ohio-abductions-friendship-between-Ariel-Castros-daughter-and-Gina-DeJesus.html | archivedate = May 8, 2013 | df = mdy-all }}</ref> Knight and DeJesus were rescued by responding officers and Castro was arrested within hours.
On May 8, 2013, Castro was charged with four counts of [[kidnapping]] and three counts of [[rape]].<ref name="plain-dealer-charges">{{Cite news | last = Caniglia | first = John | last2 = Blackwell | first2 = Brandon | date = May 9, 2013 | title = Cleveland city prosecutors charge Ariel Castro with kidnapping, rape in case of missing women | newspaper = [[The Plain Dealer]] | publisher = Cleveland Live LLC, [[Advance Publications]] | publication-place = Cleveland, OH | url = http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/cleveland_city_prosecutors_cha.html#incart_river#incart_maj-story-1 | accessdate = May 16, 2013 | format = news article posted to Cleveland.com | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130510123113/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/cleveland_city_prosecutors_cha.html#incart_river | archivedate = May 10, 2013 | df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/cleveland-kidnapping-suspect-ariel-castro-hid-dark-side/story?id=19122845 |title=Cleveland Kidnapping Suspect Ariel Castro Hid a Dark Side, His Uncle Says |last1=Perez |first1=Alex |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=ABC News |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508090308/http://abcnews.go.com/US/cleveland-kidnapping-suspect-ariel-castro-hid-dark-side/story?id=19122845 |archivedate=May 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Castro pleaded guilty to 937 criminal counts of rape, kidnapping, and [[Aggravation (law)|aggravated murder]] as part of a [[plea bargain]]. He was sentenced to life plus 1,000 years in prison without the possibility of parole.<ref name=usat072613>{{cite news |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/07/26/ariel-castro-cleveland-abduction-plea-deal-death-penalty/2589039/ |title=Ariel Castro pleads guilty in Ohio abductions |last1=Stanglin |first1=Doug |newspaper=USA Today |date=July 26, 2013 |accessdate=July 26, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130726170640/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/07/26/ariel-castro-cleveland-abduction-plea-deal-death-penalty/2589039/ |archivedate=July 26, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nation/nationnow/la-na-nn-ariel-castro-michelle-knight-20130801,0,2844274.story |last=Muskal |first=Michael |title=Ariel Castro gets life, no parole; victim says his hell awaits |publisher=latimes.com |accessdate=September 4, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130911223531/http://www.latimes.com/news/nation/nationnow/la-na-nn-ariel-castro-michelle-knight-20130801,0,2844274.story |archivedate=September 11, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> One month into his sentence, Castro committed suicide by hanging himself with bedsheets in his prison cell.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.10tv.com/content/stories/2013/09/04/Pickaway_Castro_Death.html |date=September 4, 2013 |publisher=10TV.com |title=Cleveland Kidnapper Ariel Castro Dead After Found Hanging In Prison Cell |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JNhWbTEq?url=http://www.10tv.com/content/stories/2013/09/04/Pickaway_Castro_Death.html |archivedate=September 4, 2013 |accessdate=September 4, 2013 |df=mdy }}</ref><ref name="suiciderpt"/>
==Perpetrator background== Ariel Castro was born on July 11, 1960, in [[Yauco, Puerto Rico|Yauco]], [[Puerto Rico]], to Pedro Castro and Lillian Rodriguez. When he was a child, his parents divorced. Shortly after the divorce, Castro moved to the [[contiguous United States|mainland]] with his mother and three siblings. The family first settled in [[Reading, Pennsylvania|Reading]], [[Pennsylvania]], and later moved to [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]], where Castro's father and several other extended family members were living.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.latintimes.com/articles/4018/20130515/ariel-castro-relatives-puerto-rico-evil-demon-reading-cleveland.htm |title=Ariel Castro Relatives In Puerto Rico Say He Is |url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/investigations/floor-plans-detail-inside-of-seymour-avenue-home-where-3-cleveland-women-held-captive-for-10-years |title=Floor plans detail inside of Seymour Avenue home where 3 Cleveland women held captive for 10+ years |last1=Regan |first1=Ron |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=newsnet5.com |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510110619/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/investigations/floor-plans-detail-inside-of-seymour-avenue-home-where-3-cleveland-women-held-captive-for-10-years |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> According to Figueroa's sister, Elida Caraballo, when the couple moved into their new home, "all hell started breaking loose". Caraballo and her husband Frank claim Castro beat Figueroa, breaking her nose, ribs, and arms. He also threw her down a flight of stairs, cracking her skull.<ref name="nationalpost1"/> In 1993, Castro was arrested for [[domestic violence]] but was not [[indictment|indicted]] by a [[grand jury]].<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/tv_station_reports_berry_dejes.html |title=Berry, DeJesus, Knight found alive, police source confirms |last1=Atassi |first1=Leila |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6GyIyu?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/tv_station_reports_berry_dejes.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Figueroa moved out of the home in 1996 and secured custody of her four children. Police assisted in the move and detained Castro, but did not pursue charges.<ref name="nationalpost1" /> Castro continued to threaten and attack Figueroa after she left him, according to Caraballo. A 2005 filing by Figueroa in [[Cuyahoga County, Ohio|Cuyahoga County]] [[Family court|Domestic Relations Court]] accused Castro of inflicting multiple severe injuries on her and of "frequently abduct[ing]" her daughters. A [[Injunction|temporary restraining order]] against Castro was granted, but was dismissed a few months later.<ref name="nationalpost1" /> Figueroa died in 2012 due to complications from a [[brain tumor]].<ref name="nationalpost1" />
Before his arrest at the age of 52,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://localtvwjw.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/documents.pdf|title=Request for High Bond|date=May 8, 2013|publisher=Cleveland Municipal Court Clerk of Courts Office|accessdate=May 13, 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130616082637/http://localtvwjw.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/documents.pdf|archivedate=June 16, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Castro worked as a bus driver for the [[Cleveland Metropolitan School District]] until he was fired for "bad judgment", including making an illegal [[U-turn]] with children on his bus,<ref name = autogenerated4 /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.clevelandleader.com/node/20833 |title=Ariel Castro Arrested as Suspect in Abduction and Disappearance of Three Cleveland Women |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130606212018/http://www.clevelandleader.com/node/20833 |archivedate=June 6, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> using his bus to go grocery shopping, leaving a child on the bus while he went for lunch, and leaving the bus unattended while he took a nap at home.<ref name=csm/> He was earning $18.91 per hour when he was discharged.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/ariel_castro_bus_driver_clevel.html |title=Ariel Castro fired as Cleveland school bus driver for leaving bus and going home "to rest" of his arrest, Castro's home was in [[foreclosure]] due to three years (2010–12) of unpaid [[property tax|real estate taxes]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/house_where_woman_held_captive.html |title=Cleveland house where missing women held captive is in foreclosure |last1=Sangiacomo |first1=Michael ===Michelle Knight=== Michelle Knight (born April 23, 1981) disappeared on August 23, 2002, after leaving a cousin's house.<ref name=pd050713>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/michelle_knight_plagued_by_tro.html |title=Michelle Knight's 'normal teenage life,' plagued by troubles in years before disappearance |last1=Atassi |first1=Leila |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6Bph5C?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/michelle_knight_plagued_by_tro.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> She was 21 years old at the time.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kpho.com/story/22184761/questions-still-remain-about-michelle-knights-disappearance |title=Questions still remain about Michelle Knight's disappearance |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=KPHO |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6DDqHI?url=http://www.kpho.com/story/22184761/questions-still-remain-about-michelle-knights-disappearance |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> On the day of her disappearance, she was scheduled to appear in court for a [[child custody]] case involving her son, who was in the custody of the state.<ref name=pd050713/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/09/michelle-knight-cleveland-abduction/2149003/ |title=Reports: Knight lived troubled life before abduction |last1=Eversley |first1=Melanie |last2=Alcindor |first2=Yamiche |date=May 9, 2013 |newspaper=USA Today |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6EBJwz?url=http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/09/michelle-knight-cleveland-abduction/2149003/ |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Following Knight's rescue, police acknowledged that limited resources had been spent on investigating her disappearance, in part because she was an adult. Knight was believed to have run away voluntarily due to anger over losing custody of her son. According to Cleveland Deputy Police Chief Ed Tomba, she "was the focus of very few tips".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://usnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2013/05/07/18108362-police-acknowledge-little-focus-on-finding-michelle-knight-the-third-missing-cleveland-woman?lite |title=Police acknowledge little focus on finding Michelle Knight, the third missing Cleveland woman |last1=Johnson |first1=M. Alex |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=NBC News |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6F13gS?url=http://usnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2013/05/07/18108362-police-acknowledge-little-focus-on-finding-michelle-knight-the-third-missing-cleveland-woman?lite |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Her removal from the [[National Crime Information Center]] database fifteen months after she disappeared has been criticized. [[Cleveland Division of Police|Cleveland Police]] and the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] maintain that her inclusion or exclusion had no bearing on her rescue.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/michelle_knight_held_captive_f.html |title=Michelle Knight, held captive since 2002, removed by Cleveland police from FBI database 15 months after her disappearance |last1=Atassi |first1=Leila |date=May 9, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6GBBzy?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/michelle_knight_held_captive_f.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
===Amanda Berry=== Amanda Marie Berry (born April 22, 1986) disappeared on April 21, 2003, the day before her 17th birthday.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-22433057 |title=Profile: Amanda Berry, Georgina DeJesus and Michele Knight |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=BBC |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6J4MVu?url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-22433057 |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> She was last heard from when she called her sister to tell her that she was getting a ride home from her job at a [[Burger King]] at West 110th Street and [[Ohio State Route 10|Lorain Avenue]].<ref name= newsnet5-found /> The FBI initially considered Berry a [[Runaway (dependent)|runaway]] until a week after her disappearance, when an unidentified male used her cell phone to call her mother, saying, "I have Amanda. She's fine and will be coming home in a couple of days".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/amanda_berrys_cell_phone_used.html |title=Amanda Berry's cell phone used a week after she went missing |last1=Guevara |first1=Damian |last2=Caniglia |first2=John |date=November 15, 2003 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6KYstD?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/amanda_berrys_cell_phone_used.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://newsfeed.time.com/2013/05/07/found-timeline-of-ohio-women-missing-since-2002/ |title=Found: Timeline of Ohio Women Missing Since 2002 |last1=Gray |first1=Madison |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=Time |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6LIBXd?url=http://newsfeed.time.com/2013/05/07/found-timeline-of-ohio-women-missing-since-2002/ |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Berry was featured in a 2004 segment of [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]]'s ''[[America's Most Wanted]]'' (re-aired in 2005 and 2006), which linked her to Gina DeJesus, who by that point had also gone missing in Cleveland.<ref name=autogenerated3 /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amw.com/missing_children/case.cfm?id=25773 |title=Amanda Berry |date=May 6, 2013 |publisher=America's Most Wanted |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510102825/http://www.amw.com/missing_children/case.cfm?id=25773 |archivedate=May 10, 2013 }}</ref> Berry and DeJesus were profiled on ''[[The Oprah Winfrey Show]]'' and ''[[The Montel Williams Show]]'', where in 2004 self-proclaimed psychic [[Sylvia Browne]] told Berry's mother, Louwana Miller, that her daughter was dead and that she was "in water".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/story.aspx?storyid=26501 |title=Amanda Berry's mother asks Psychic Sylvia Browne 'Is she out there' |date=November 18, 2004 |publisher=WKYC |accessdate=May 13, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/daughter-found-women-missing-decade/story?id=19122795 |title=Kidnap Victim Amanda Berry Hailed as 'Real Hero' in Rescue of Three Women |last1=Goldman |first1=Russell |last2=Dolak |first2=Kevin |last3=Muir |first3=David |last4=Castellano |first4=Anthony |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=ABC News |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508083940/http://abcnews.go.com/US/daughter-found-women-missing-decade/story?id=19122795 |archivedate=May 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www2.macleans.ca/2013/05/07/psychic-on-the-montel-williams-show-said-amanda-berry-was-dead/ |title=Psychic on The Montel Williams Show said Amanda Berry was dead. She wasn't. |last1=Senger |first1=Emily |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=Maclean's |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130513043608/http://www2.macleans.ca/2013/05/07/psychic-on-the-montel-williams-show-said-amanda-berry-was-dead/ |archivedate=May 13, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.oprah.com/oprahshow/Abductions-of-Amanda-Berry-Gina-DeJesus-and-Ashley-Summers-Video |title=The Abductions of Amanda Berry, Gina DeJesus & Ashley Summers |date=October 12, 2009 |publisher=Oprah.com |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no This pronouncement devastated her mother, causing her to take down pictures and give away Berry's computer.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/amanda_berry_is_dead_psychic_t.html |title=Amanda Berry is dead, psychic tells her mother on Montel Williams' show |last1=Hudak |first1=Stephen Miller continued to search for Berry until her death from [[heart failure]] in 2006.<ref name=autogenerated3>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/amanda_berrys_mother_louwana_m.html |title=Amanda Berry's mother, Louwana Miller, dies without the answers she's sought for 3 years |last1=Guevara In July 2012, Robert Wolford, a prison inmate who previously lived in Tremont, claimed to have information about the location of Berry's body and led police to an empty lot on Cleveland's West Side, where a fruitless search was conducted.<ref name=autogenerated3 /><ref name="3 missing women found">{{cite news |author1=Sheeran, Thomas J. |author2=Coyne, John |lastauthoramp=yes |url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/2-women-missing-decade-found-alive-ohio |title=3 missing women found in Ohio, 3 brothers arrested |agency=Associated Press |date=May 7, 2013 |accessdate=May 14, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6azULh?url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/2-women-missing-decade-found-alive-ohio |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Wolford was sentenced in January 2013 to four-and-a-half years in prison for [[obstruction of justice]], [[making false statements|making a false report]], and making a false alarm.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/cleveland_metro/ohio-inmate-robert-wolford-gets-4-years-in-false-amanda-berry-search-tip |title=Ohio inmate Robert Wolford gets 4 years in false Amanda Berry search tip |date=January 16, 2013 |publisher=newsnet5.com |agency=Associated Press |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130507132144/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/cleveland_metro/ohio-inmate-robert-wolford-gets-4-years-in-false-amanda-berry-search-tip |archivedate=May 7, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
On December 25, 2006, Berry gave birth to a daughter <!-- Please do not add the daughter's name, see talk page for more details. --> at 2207 Seymour Avenue.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10047663/Ohio-kidnappings-Michelle-Knight-forced-to-deliver-Amanda-Berrys-baby-on-Christmas-Day.html |title=Ohio kidnappings: Michelle Knight forced to deliver Amanda Berry's baby on Christmas Day |last1=Swaine |first1=Jon |date=May 9, 2013 |newspaper=The Telegraph |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511210935/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10047663/Ohio-kidnappings-Michelle-Knight-forced-to-deliver-Amanda-Berrys-baby-on-Christmas-Day.html |archivedate=May 11, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> DNA evidence has confirmed that Castro was the biological father of the child.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/ariel_castro_is_father_of_aman.html |title=Ariel Castro is father of Amanda Berry's child, state DNA results say |date=May 10, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130607110711/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/ariel_castro_is_father_of_aman.html |archivedate=June 7, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/298935/45/Investigator-Ariel-Castro-says-hes-cold-blooded |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130615084817/http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/298935/45/Investigator-Ariel-Castro-says-hes-cold-blooded |dead-url=yes |archive-date=June 15, 2013 |title=Investigator: Ariel Castro says he's "cold blooded" |last1=Meyer |first1=Tom |date=May 10, 2013 |publisher=WKYC |accessdate=May 13, 2013 }}</ref>
===Gina DeJesus=== [[Image:Gina-suspect-sketch.jpg|thumb|upright|right|180px|2004 FBI sketch of a suspect in DeJesus' disappearance]] Georgina "Gina" Lynn DeJesus (born February 13, 1990) went missing at age 14.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.cleveland.com/pdextra/2008/04/six_long_days_gina_still_missi.html |title=Six long days, Gina still missing Parents, police, city officials focus on case at community meeting |last1=Zicari |first1=Peter |date=April 1, 2008 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20130517194140/http://blog.cleveland.com/pdextra/2008/04/six_long_days_gina_still_missi.html |archivedate=May 17, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> She was last seen at a [[payphone]] at about 3 p.m. on April 2, 2004, on the way home from her [[middle school]] at West 105th Street and Lorain Avenue. DeJesus and her friend, Castro's daughter Arlene, had called Figueroa for permission to have a sleepover at DeJesus's house, but Figueroa replied they could not and the two girls parted ways.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/suspects_daughter_said_in_2004.html |title=Suspect's daughter said in 2004 she was the last to see Gina DeJesus |last1=Dissell |first1=Rachel |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6Vrz5i?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/suspects_daughter_said_in_2004.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Arlene was the last person to see DeJesus before her disappearance.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/cleveland-kidnapping-latest-police-twice-visited-house-in-ohio--but-missed-three-women-held-captive-for-a-decade-8605381.html |title=Cleveland kidnapping: Son reveals his father padlocked doors to basement because 'we weren't allowed to go there' |last1=Kumar |first1=Nikhil |last2=Usborne |first2=David |date=May 8, 2013 |newspaper=The Independent |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508011422/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/cleveland-kidnapping-latest-police-twice-visited-house-in-ohio--but-missed-three-women-held-captive-for-a-decade-8605381.html |archivedate=May 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
DeJesus was taken under the impression that she was being dropped off, and trusted Castro because she was friends with his teenage daughter. Because no one witnessed DeJesus's abduction, an [[AMBER Alert]] was not issued, which angered DeJesus's father. He said in 2006, "The Amber Alert should work for any missing child … Whether it's an abduction or a runaway, a child needs to be found. We need to change this law".<ref name="3 missing women found"/>
A year after DeJesus' disappearance, the FBI released a [[composite sketch]] and description of a male suspect, described as "Latino, 25 to 35 years of age, {{convert|5|ft|10|in}}, {{convert|165|to|185|lb}}, with green eyes, a [[goatee]] and possibly a pencil-thin beard".<ref>{{cite web |last=Swaine |first=Jon |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10045464/Ohio-abductions-FBI-photofit-with-likeness-to-suspect-Ariel-Castro-held-for-seven-years-as-police-say-he-acted-alone.html |title=Ohio abductions: FBI photofit with likeness to suspect Ariel Castro held for seven years as police say he acted alone |publisher=Telegraph.co.uk |date=May 9, 2013 |accessdate=September 4, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130608063305/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10045464/Ohio-abductions-FBI-photofit-with-likeness-to-suspect-Ariel-Castro-held-for-seven-years-as-police-say-he-acted-alone.html |archivedate=June 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> According to court records, Castro was {{convert|5|ft|7|in}}, {{convert|179|lb}}; he had brown eyes and a goatee.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/story.aspx?storyid=33093 |title=Printout: FBI releases sketch of Gina DeJesus' alleged kidnapper |date=April 15, 2005 |publisher=WKYC |accessdate=May 13, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/news/article.cfm?c_id=2&objectid=10882714 |title=FBI had sketch of suspect but missed the connection |date=May 10, 2013 |newspaper=The New Zealand Herald |accessdate=May 13, 2013}}</ref>
DeJesus was featured in the aforementioned ''America's Most Wanted'' segment, which linked her to Berry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amw.com/missing_children/case.cfm?id=26744 |title=Gina DeJesus |date=May 6, 2013 |publisher=America's Most Wanted |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130609014439/http://www.amw.com/missing_children/case.cfm?id=26744 |archivedate=June 9, 2013 }}</ref> The disappearances received regular media attention over the years, continuing into 2012, while the families held public [[vigil]]s. Castro attended at least two of these vigils,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://globalnews.ca/video/542366/extended-interview-with-family-of-kidnapping-victim-gina-dejesus/ |title=Extended: Interview with
